intro: Libanotis intermedia, commonly known as the intermediate libanotis, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the Mediterranean region. It typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring basal rosettes of lanceolate, hairy leaves. The plant produces small, pale blue or violet flowers arranged in dense clusters, which bloom in late spring to early summer. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun to partial shade, making it suitable for rock gardens and borders. Its ornamental value is enhanced by its compact growth habit and long-lasting floral display.
